ygData.subject: Taking the plunge - starting EQ tomorrow
ygData.msgSnippet: Hail, fellow adventurers. The software s on its way, and I should be ready to start playing EQ tomorrow evening (3/13). I come from an AD&D (actually original
ygData.messageBody:
Hail, fellow adventurers. The software's on its
way, and I should be ready to start playing EQ
tomorrow evening (3/13). I come from an AD&D (actually
original D&D, but who's counting) background, and for my
first character, I've decided to play what I know best
-- a dwarf rogue (although I'll always think
"thief"). Anyway, a couple of questions before I get too
far: <br><br>1. How do I tell what server I'm on? Can
I change that (I assume not), or is it based on
your location/IP address? Are some servers better than
others? Do all the PK people play on the same
server?<br><br>2. Any suggestions on how best to set up my
character? Add points to Agility? Dexterity? Strength?
Intelligence -- ?! (I sort of dislike the idea that dwarves in
this world are dumb.)<br><br>3. One guide suggested
using skill points only for the "craft skills" -- my
thieving skills, in other words. Another suggested
throwing a point each at piercing and another weapon
skill. Any ideas?<br><br>4. Clans -- do most people join
one, or maybe wait until later in their
career?<br><br>5. Anything else? <br><br>Thanks in advance.
